intro: Bystropogon maderensis var. valdehirsitus, commonly known as the Canary Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. It has palmate leaves and produces bright yellow stamens that are prominent in its floral display. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
